sen.j: 弓削豊穂（ゆげのとよほ）は、日本の古墳時代にいたとされる人物である。
sen.e: YUGE no Toyoho is a person in the Tumulus period of Japan.
YUGE no Toyoho is a person in the Tumulus period of Japan.
YUGE no Toyoho is a person in the Tumulus period of Japan.
The year of birth and death unknown.
The year of birth and death unknown.
The year of birth and death unknown.
Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji.
Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji.
Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji.

sen.j: 雄略天皇の命により、神事を汚して逃げた凡河内香賜を殺した。
sen.e: He killed OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu who profaned a Shinto ritual and ran away by order of Emperor Yuryaku.
He killed OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu who had profaned a Shinto ritual and run away, by order of Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: who profaned a Shinto ritual and ran away --> who had profaned a Shinto ritual and run away
sen.e: He killed OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu who had profaned a Shinto ritual and run away, by order of Emperor Yuryaku.

sen.j: 弓削氏は弓の製作にあたった弓削部を管掌した伴造の一族で、豊穂は史書に現われる弓削氏最古の人物である。
sen.e: The Yuge clan was a Tomonomiyatsuko (the chief of various departments at the Imperial Court) taking charge of Yugebe which made bows and Toyoho is the oldest person of the Yuge clan appearing in a history book.

The Yuge clan was a Tomonomiyatsuko (the chief of various departments at the Imperial Court) that supervised Yugebe in charge of making bows, and Toyoho is the oldest person of the Yuge clan appearing in a history book.

The Yuge clan was a Tomonomiyatsuko (the chief of various departments at the Imperial Court) that supervised Yugebe in charge of making bows, and Toyoho is the oldest person of the Yuge clan appearing in a history book.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』雄略天皇9年（465年）2月1日条にのみ見える。
sen.e: He is only in the article of February 1, 465, Emperor Yuryaku, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He only appears in the article of February 1, 465, Emperor Yuryaku, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He only appears in the article of February 1, 465, Emperor Yuryaku, "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: この日、雄略天皇は宗像三女神（宗像神社の神）を祀るために凡河内香賜と采女を遣わした。
sen.e: On that day, Emperor Yuryaku dispatched OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu and a court lady to worship Munakata Sanjojin (three goddesses enshrined in Munakata-jinja Shrine).
On that day, Emperor Yuryaku dispatched OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu and a court lady to worship Munakata Sanjojin (three goddesses enshrined in Munakata-jinja Shrine).
On that day, Emperor Yuryaku dispatched OSHIKAWACHI no Katabu and a court lady to worship Munakata Sanjojin (three goddesses enshrined in Munakata-jinja Shrine).

sen.j: しかるに神事の前に香賜が采女を犯したので、天皇が難波日鷹を遣わして誅殺しようとしたところ、香賜は逃げて行方をくらました。
sen.e: Katabu, however, assaulted a court lady before Shinto rituals so that Emperor tried to kill him by sending NANIWA no Hitaka, but Katabu ran away and disappeared.
However, as Katabu had assaulted the court lady before the Shinto ritual, the Emperor sent NANIWA no Hitaka to kill him, but Katabu ran away and disappeared.
However, as Katabu had assaulted the court lady before the Shinto ritual, the Emperor sent NANIWA no Hitaka to kill him, but Katabu ran away and disappeared.

sen.j: そこで弓削豊穂が捜索に派遣された。
sen.e: Therefore YUGE no Toyoho was sent to search him.
Therefore YUGE no Toyoho was sent to search for him.
Therefore YUGE no Toyoho was sent to search for him.

sen.j: 国内の県を探し回った後、三島郡 (大阪府)の藍原（現在の大阪府茨木市安威）で香賜を捕らえて斬り殺した。
sen.e: After searching prefectures in Japan, he caught and killed Katabu in Ainohara, Mishima County (now Ai, Ibaraki City, Osaka Prefecture).
After searching prefectures in Japan, he captured and killed Katabu in Ainohara, Mishima County (present Ai, Ibaraki City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: caughtをcapturedに、nowを presentに変更しました。
sen.e: After searching prefectures in Japan, he captured and killed Katabu in Ainohara, Mishima County (present Ai, Ibaraki City, Osaka Prefecture).
